narrativeSections.additionalInfo: You are a medic in a civil affairs element operating in a small urban environment in support of our US embassy. While not directly a threat, drug cartels operate in the area.

Your team is in one vehicle en route to a key leader engagement when a civilian car strikes your vehicle on the driver side at a crossroads. Both vehicles have damage, but your team is able to self-evacuate from the vehicle. Two of your team members have injuries and you do not know if there are other casualties in the other car.

narrativeSections.sectionDescription: After the Soartech introduction plays, play this first radio message which prompts a question
narrativeSections.additionalInfo: Doc, are you going to search for more patients or help those two first?

probe.question: Soartech Probe 1: Doc, are you going to search for more patients or help those two first?

narrativeSections.sectionDescription: Response to probe answer; start treatment
narrativeSections.additionalInfo: Doc, everyone else is accounted for, there are no additional injured people.

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: When either patient is treated, both patients lose consciousness and supplies reset
When either patient is treated, both patients lose consciousness and supplies reset
More patients found; local medical provider will take over here
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: Doc, we were wrong, there are more injured people - civilians from the other vehicle. A local medical provider is arriving, please move to the other patients after tagging your teammates

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: More patients found; local medical provider will take over here
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: Doc, we were wrong, there are more injured people - civilians from the other vehicle. A local medical provider is arriving, please move to the other patients after tagging your teammates

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: Tagged both patients; moving to second half of soartech scenario

narrativeSections.sectionDescription: After the scene loads, play this first radio which prompts a question
narrativeSections.additionalInfo: We are unsure if there are more casualties from the other vehicle. Do you want to search or engage these patients?

probe.question: Soartech Probe 2: Are you going to search for more patients or help those two first?

narrativeSections.sectionDescription: After answering the question, this radio message will autoplay and start the triage process
narrativeSections.additionalInfo: We have other people searching. Please help these patients.

narrativeSections.sectionDescription: Automated section here of treatment and tagging both patients. Then switches back to the original patients
narrativeSections.additionalInfo: We have other people searching. Please help these patients.

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: When either patient is treated, both patients lose consciousness and supplies refill
When either patient is treated, both patients lose consciousness and supplies refill
When both patients have been treated, the local medical provider will take over
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: Doc, the local medical provider will take over there. Please tag the patients and return to your team.

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: When both patients have been treated, the local medical provider will take over
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: Doc, the local medical provider will take over there. Please tag the patients and return to your team.
You are the only medic on the scene after there was some kind of shooting between civilians. The local civilian hospital does not have significant surgical capabilities.

narrativeSections.additionalInfo: You do not have time to treat both patients, and both are likely to die without treatment. The civilian in black clothes has injuries that are definitely treatable, but the other civilian may die even if treated, due to the limited capabilities of the local hospital.

narrativeSections.sectionDescription: Automated section here of decision making during patient treatment

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: If shooter is engaged, help victim
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: I saw what happened. The guy you're treating just started screaming about how it wasn't right that the other guy got promoted. Then, he shot the other guy a couple of times and kicked him. It was a savage attack and he wouldn't have stopped if security hadn't shot him. Don't you think you should try to help the victim?

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: If victim is engaged, help shooter
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: I saw what happened. That other guy just started screaming and shot him, before getting shot by security. This poor guy might be beyond help now. It's sad because he was just a victim here. But there's just no place around here that could do the kind of surgery needed to save his life after an injury like that. Don't you think you should try to help the other guy, since his injury is probably survivable if you can stop the bleeding?

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: If shooter is treated, consider transporting victim
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: That poor victim would have no chance at all in the local civilian hospital, but the surgeon at the US military hospital might be able to save his life. You should consider transporting him.

narrativeResponse.sectionDescription: If victim is treated, consider transporting shooter
narrativeResponse.additionalInfo: You did your best for this guy, but his prognosis looks really bad. In his condition, he is very unlikely to even survive being transported.

narrativeSections.additionalInfo: The med-evac is inbound. Which patient are they evacuating?

probe.question: Adept Probe 3: The med-evac is inbound. Which patient are they evacuating?
